title: Authors and Citation
text: Mukesha D (2026). GeneScout: De Novo Small ORF Discovery Entropy Analysis. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/danymukesha/GeneScout.
code: @Manual{,   title = {GeneScout: De Novo Small ORF Discovery with Entropy Analysis},   author = {Dany Mukesha},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/danymukesha/GeneScout}, }

what: De Novo Small ORF Discovery with Entropy Analysis
title: De Novo Small ORF Discovery with Entropy Analysis
text: GeneScout R package identifying hidden genes non-coding DNA using statistical information theory. implements sliding window entropy scanning, Shannon entropy calculation, Kullback-Leibler divergence discover potential small open reading frames (ORFs) genomic sequences without requiring prior annotation. existing bioinformatics tools codon usage bias analysis (like coRdon Biostrings) designed analyzing known genes annotated GTF/GFF files. optimized discovery non-coding regions. GeneScout fills gap focusing de novo small ORF discovery large genomic regions. key features tool : Sliding window entropy scanning: implementation efficiently scan millions base pairs find regions unusual codon usage patterns Shannon entropy calculation: measures randomness codon distributions Kullback-Leibler divergence: Compare regions organism-specific codon usage profiles ORF setection: Find candidate open reading frames low-entropy regions Reference profil creation: build organism-specific codon usage profiles known genes

title: De Novo Small ORF Discovery with Entropy Analysis
De Novo Small ORF Discovery with Entropy Analysis
code: library(GeneScout)  # Create a reference profile from known genes known_genes <- c("ATGATGATG", "GCCGCCGCC", "TTATTATTA") ref_profile <- create_reference_profile(known_genes)  # Scan a genomic sequence sequence <- paste(rep("ATGATGATGTTATTATTACGCCGCCGCC", 30), collapse = "") scan_result <- sliding_window_scan(   sequence,   window_size = 300,   step_size = 30,   reference_profile = ref_profile )  # Detect entropy peaks peaks <- entropy_peak_detection(scan_result, threshold = 0.1)  # Find candidate ORFs candidates <- find_candidate_orfs(sequence, scan_result, peaks)  # Visualize results plot_candidate_orfs(scan_result, candidates, peaks)

title: De Novo Small ORF Discovery with Entropy Analysis
text: H=−∑=164P()log2P()H = -\sum_{=1}^{64} P() \log_2 P() High entropy (~6 bits): Random codon usage → non-coding DNA Low entropy (~3-4 bits): Biased codon usage → potential gene

title: De Novo Small ORF Discovery with Entropy Analysis
text: DKL(P∥Q)=∑iP()log2(P()Q())D_{KL}(P \| Q) = \sum_{} P() \log_2 \left( \frac{P()}{Q()} \right) Compares observed codon distribution (PP) reference distribution (QQ). different use cases, : De nove gene dscovery: find potential coding regions unannotated genomes Small ORF identification: discovering small peptides non-coding regions Comparative genomics: comparing codon usage organisms RNA-Seq integration: validating candidate ORFs expression data Evolutionary studies: analze codon usage patterns across lineages

title: De Novo Small ORF Discovery with Entropy Analysis
text: Built top Bioconductor’s excellent Biostrings, coRdon, ggplot2 packages.

title: Calculate Codon Frequencies — calculate_codon_frequencies
text: Calculate frequency distribution 64 codons DNA sequence.

title: Calculate Codon Frequencies — calculate_codon_frequencies
text: sequence Character string DNAString object representing DNA sequence normalize Boolean indicating whether normalize frequencies (default: TRUE)

title: Calculate Codon Frequencies — calculate_codon_frequencies
text: Named numeric vector codon frequencies

what: Calculate Effective Number of Codons (ENC) — calculate_enc
title: Calculate Effective Number of Codons (ENC) — calculate_enc
text: Calculate Effective Number Codons (ENC), measure codon usage bias. ENC ranges 20 (extreme bias) 61 (bias).

title: Calculate Effective Number of Codons (ENC) — calculate_enc
Calculate Effective Number of Codons (ENC) — calculate_enc
text: frequencies Named numeric vector codon frequencies

title: Calculate Effective Number of Codons (ENC) — calculate_enc
text: Numeric value ENC

title: Calculate Effective Number of Codons (ENC) — calculate_enc
code: sequence <- "ATGATGATGTTATTATTACGCCGCCGCC" freqs <- calculate_codon_frequencies(sequence) enc <- calculate_enc(freqs) #> [1] 6 #> [1] "enc: 0 entro: 0" #> [1] 6 #> [1] "enc: 0 entro: 0" #> [1] 1 #> [1] "enc: 0 entro: 0"

title: Calculate Kullback-Leibler Divergence — calculate_kl_divergence
text: Calculate Kullback-Leibler (KL) divergence two codon frequency distributions. measures one distribution diverges second, expected distribution.

title: Calculate Kullback-Leibler Divergence — calculate_kl_divergence
text: observed Named numeric vector observed codon frequencies reference Named numeric vector reference codon frequencies epsilon Small value avoid log(0) (default: 1e-10)

title: Calculate Kullback-Leibler Divergence — calculate_kl_divergence
text: Numeric value KL divergence

title: Calculate Kullback-Leibler Divergence — calculate_kl_divergence
code: sequence1 <- "ATGATGATGTTATTATTACGCCGCCGCC" sequence2 <- "TTATTATTACGCCGCCGCCATGATGATG" freqs1 <- calculate_codon_frequencies(sequence1) freqs2 <- calculate_codon_frequencies(sequence2) kl_div <- calculate_kl_divergence(freqs1, freqs2)

title: Compare Entropy Profiles — compare_entropy_profiles
text: Compare entropy profiles multiple sequences regions.

title: Compare Entropy Profiles — compare_entropy_profiles
text: ... One scan results named lists scan results metric Character string: "shannon_entropy" "kl_divergence" labels Optional character vector labels profile

title: Compare Entropy Profiles — compare_entropy_profiles
text: ggplot2 object

title: Compare Entropy Profiles — compare_entropy_profiles
code: seq1 <- paste(rep("ATGATGATG", 30), collapse = "") seq2 <- paste(rep("ACGTACGT", 30), collapse = "") result1 <- sliding_window_scan(seq1, window_size = 100, step_size = 20) result2 <- sliding_window_scan(seq2, window_size = 100, step_size = 20) plot <- compare_entropy_profiles(result1, result2, labels = c("Region 1", "Region 2")) #> Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the GeneScout package. #>   Please report the issue at <https://github.com/danymukesha/GeneScout/issues>.

title: Detect Entropy Peaks — entropy_peak_detection
text: Identify peaks entropy profiles may indicate potential coding regions.

title: Detect Entropy Peaks — entropy_peak_detection
code: entropy_peak_detection(   scan_result,   metric = "shannon_entropy",   method = "quantile",   threshold = 0.1,   min_peak_width = 3 )

title: Detect Entropy Peaks — entropy_peak_detection
text: scan_result Data frame sliding_window_scan() metric Character string: "shannon_entropy" "kl_divergence" method Character string: "quantile" "sd" threshold calculation threshold Quantile threshold ("quantile" method) number SDs ("sd" method) min_peak_width Minimum width peaks windows (default: 3)

title: Detect Entropy Peaks — entropy_peak_detection
text: Data frame peak information

title: Detect Entropy Peaks — entropy_peak_detection
code: sequence <- paste(rep("ATGATGATGTTATTATTACGCCGCCGCC", 20), collapse = "") result <- sliding_window_scan(sequence, window_size = 150, step_size = 30) peaks <- entropy_peak_detection(result, threshold = 0.1) #> Warning: No peaks detected with current threshold

what: Extract Known Genes from GTF/GFF File — extract_known_genes
title: Extract Known Genes from GTF/GFF File — extract_known_genes
text: Extract gene sequences GTF/GFF annotation file corresponding genome FASTA. function parses annotation file get gene coordinates extracts sequences genome FASTA file.

title: Extract Known Genes from GTF/GFF File — extract_known_genes
code: extract_known_genes(   gtf_file,   genome_fasta,   feature_type = "gene",   gene_attribute = "gene_id",   min_length = 300,   max_genes = Inf )

title: Extract Known Genes from GTF/GFF File — extract_known_genes
text: gtf_file Character string specifying path GTF/GFF file genome_fasta Character string specifying path genome FASTA file feature_type Character string specifying feature type extract (default: "gene", alternatives: "exon", "CDS", "transcript") gene_attribute Character string specifying gene ID attribute (default: "gene_id") min_length Minimum gene length base pairs (default: 300) max_genes Maximum number genes extract (default: Inf)

title: Extract Known Genes from GTF/GFF File — extract_known_genes
text: Character vector gene sequences

title: Extract Known Genes from GTF/GFF File — extract_known_genes
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Extract gene sequences from GTF and genome files known_genes <- extract_known_genes(     gtf_file = "annotations.gtf",     genome_fasta = "genome.fasta",     min_length = 300 )  # Create reference profile ref_profile <- create_reference_profile(known_genes) } # }

title: Find Candidate ORFs — find_candidate_orfs
text: Identify candidate open reading frames (ORFs) based entropy analysis sequence features.

title: Find Candidate ORFs — find_candidate_orfs
code: find_candidate_orfs(   sequence,   scan_result,   peaks,   min_orf_length = 90,   start_codons = c("ATG"),   stop_codons = c("TAA", "TAG", "TGA") )

title: Find Candidate ORFs — find_candidate_orfs
text: sequence Character string DNAString object representing DNA sequence scan_result Data frame sliding_window_scan() peaks Data frame entropy_peak_detection() min_orf_length Minimum ORF length base pairs (default: 90, .e., 30 aa) start_codons Character vector valid start codons (default: c("ATG")) stop_codons Character vector stop codons (default: c("TAA", "TAG", "TGA"))

title: Find Candidate ORFs — find_candidate_orfs
text: Data frame candidate ORF information

title: Find Candidate ORFs — find_candidate_orfs
code: sequence <- paste(rep("ATGATGATGTTATTATTACGCCGCCGCC", 20), collapse = "") result <- sliding_window_scan(sequence, window_size = 150, step_size = 30) peaks <- entropy_peak_detection(result, threshold = 0.1) #> Warning: No peaks detected with current threshold candidates <- find_candidate_orfs(sequence, result, peaks) #> Warning: No peaks provided, returning empty data frame

title: Find ORFs in Sequence — find_orfs_in_sequence
text: sequence Character string DNA sequence min_orf_length Minimum ORF length base pairs start_codons Character vector start codons stop_codons Character vector stop codons

title: Find ORFs in Sequence — find_orfs_in_sequence
text: Data frame ORF information

title: Plot Candidate ORFs — plot_candidate_orfs
text: Visualize candidate ORFs along entropy profile.

title: Plot Candidate ORFs — plot_candidate_orfs
code: plot_candidate_orfs(   scan_result,   candidates,   peaks = NULL,   metric = "shannon_entropy" )

title: Plot Candidate ORFs — plot_candidate_orfs
text: scan_result Data frame sliding_window_scan() candidates Data frame find_candidate_orfs() peaks Optional data frame entropy_peak_detection() metric Character string: "shannon_entropy" "kl_divergence"

title: Plot Candidate ORFs — plot_candidate_orfs
text: ggplot2 object

title: Plot Candidate ORFs — plot_candidate_orfs
code: sequence <- paste(rep("ATGATGATGTTATTATTACGCCGCCGCC", 20), collapse = "") result <- sliding_window_scan(sequence, window_size = 150, step_size = 30) peaks <- entropy_peak_detection(result, threshold = 0.1) #> Warning: No peaks detected with current threshold candidates <- find_candidate_orfs(sequence, result, peaks) #> Warning: No peaks provided, returning empty data frame plot <- plot_candidate_orfs(result, candidates, peaks)

title: Plot Entropy Profile — plot_entropy_profile
text: Create visualization entropy metrics across scanned sequence.

title: Plot Entropy Profile — plot_entropy_profile
code: plot_entropy_profile(   scan_result,   peaks = NULL,   metric = "shannon_entropy",   highlight_threshold = TRUE,   show_peaks = FALSE )

title: Plot Entropy Profile — plot_entropy_profile
text: scan_result Data frame sliding_window_scan() peaks Optional data frame entropy_peak_detection() metric Character string: "shannon_entropy" "kl_divergence" highlight_threshold Boolean indicating whether show threshold line show_peaks Boolean indicating whether highlight detected peaks

title: Plot Entropy Profile — plot_entropy_profile
text: ggplot2 object

title: Plot Entropy Profile — plot_entropy_profile
code: sequence <- paste(rep("ATGATGATGTTATTATTACGCCGCCGCC", 20), collapse = "") result <- sliding_window_scan(sequence, window_size = 150, step_size = 30) plot <- plot_entropy_profile(result)

title: Read FASTA File — read_fasta
text: Read DNA sequences FASTA file convert Biostrings DNAStringSet.

title: Read FASTA File — read_fasta
text: file_path Character string specifying path FASTA file

title: Read FASTA File — read_fasta

title: Sliding Window Entropy Scan — sliding_window_scan
text: Perform sliding window scan across DNA sequence calculate entropy KL divergence metrics position. main function de novo ORF discovery.

title: Sliding Window Entropy Scan — sliding_window_scan
code: sliding_window_scan(   sequence,   window_size = 300,   step_size = 30,   reference_profile = NULL,   min_codons = 10 )

title: Sliding Window Entropy Scan — sliding_window_scan
text: sequence Character string DNAString object representing DNA sequence window_size Integer size sliding window base pairs (default: 300) step_size Integer step size sliding window (default: 30) reference_profile Optional reference codon frequency profile. NULL, Shannon entropy calculated. min_codons Minimum number complete codons required analysis (default: 10)

title: Sliding Window Entropy Scan — sliding_window_scan
text: data frame window coordinates entropy metrics

title: Sliding Window Entropy Scan — sliding_window_scan
code: sequence <- paste(rep("ATGATGATGTTATTATTACGCCGCCGCC", 20), collapse = "") result <- sliding_window_scan(sequence, window_size = 150, step_size = 30)
